text:
A standing ovation for Angelina Jolie!

The 42-year-old actress received a warm welcome after screening her film, First They Killed My Father, at the 2017 Telluride Film Festival in Colorado on Saturday.

RELATED: Angelina Jolie Fights Back Against 'Vanity Fair' Tell-All Excerpt: 'False and Upsetting'

Getty Images

Getty Images

Jolie, who directed and co-wrote the movie with Loung Ung based on Ung's memoir of the same name, was joined by the film's cast and crew -- and two of her own children.

Maddox, who helped his mother in the production of the Netflix film, and Pax supported their mom on stage after the screening, which left the audience in tears.

The extraordinarily beautiful Angelina Jolie at the world premiere of her film with her crew and two of her kids #FirstTheyKilledMyFatherpic.twitter.com/6MAw1dfe6i — J Don Birnam (@jdonbirnam) September 2, 2017

Standing O and not a dry eye for #AngelinaJolie and her film at #TellurideFilmFestivalpic.twitter.com/avizoQl6c6 — J Don Birnam (@jdonbirnam) September 2, 2017

Angelina Jolie gets standing ovation. pic.twitter.com/eIDbLkyi6Y — Anne Thompson (@akstanwyck) September 2, 2017

WATCH: Why Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie Have Slowed Down Their Divorce Process -- And No, They're Not Getting Back To

Meanwhile, Jolie recently found herself fighting back against an excerpt from her recent Vanity Fair tell-all, which discussed alleged "game" First They Killed My Father producers played with children while casting the film.

See more in the video below.
title: Angelina Jolie Receives Warm Welcome at Telluride Film Festival, Brings Kids on Stage After Movie Screening
